column4: Has Mozilla VPN been audited by a third party to verify "no log" claims
column5: Has Mozilla VPN been audited by a third party to verify "no log" claims

I'm trying to start up Mozilla VPN on my windows 10. The app gets stuck on the 'waiting for sign in subscription confirmation'. The app works perfectly on my android phone but I have not been able to get it to work on my windows computer. I have tried restarting my computer, re-installing the Mozilla VPN app but hasn't worked yet.
Got a "The zip code you supplied failed validation." when I am trying to subscribe for Mozilla VPN using a Canadian zipcode. Mozilla VPN is currently available in Canada correct?

The FAQ currently only states that Mozilla VPN uses Mullvad servers but does not go into detail on how the user's anonymity is guarded.

Mullvad uses numbered accounts and you can even pay cash to remain anonymous.

How does Mozilla provide anonymity for VPN customer? Are the numbered accounts somehow used?

After installing Mozilla VPN and establishing a connection it worked for about 2 minutes. Then it said it was connected but I couldn't connect to anything over the Internet.

After I disconnected and reconnected it now says "No Signal, No connection" inside of the app.

I have opened a ticket with support in addition to posting here. I will post the outcome from that here to help others.

Meanwhile, do you have any thoughts on what could be the issue?

OS: Windows 10 Pro x64 (V 2004)

Mozilla VPN keeps crashing when I try to open it. I am running it on a Windows 10 20.04 machine, and I have already tried reinstalling the app. I really need access to the VPN because I'm on public wifi, and would prefer my work to be encrypted. Please help!

To explain how it is crashing, I will click the app to open it, and it will show in the icon tray for a second and then disappear.

column4: Offered Mozilla VPN in NZ but iOS app not in App Store
column5:
Hi,

I received an invite to try Mozilla VPN, I am based in New Zealand and your FAQs say the service is now available here.

But for iOS the App Store here only features Firefox Private VPN. Is this the same app with earlier branding? Is it different to Mozilla VPN? I notice you also have seperate product pages. So I'm unclear which I should use.

Hi, do you have servers in Portland Oregon

Thank you

column4: I paid for vpn service and discovered that VPN is not available for Mac, I want a refund and remove my card info.
column5: I use a Mac and didn't see a mention of that until I had already been charged $4.99. Now I would like to get a refund and remove my card info from the system.
